AAD.caption: animation
AAD.doc: Specifies the type of animation to apply. This property determines how elements within the container will animate when they come into view.
AAD.name: animation

AAH.caption: rg-container
AAH.doc: Specifies the ID of the container element of the repeating group to which the animation will be applied.
AAH.name: container

AAI.caption: easing
AAI.doc: Specifies the easing function to be used for the animation. Easing functions control the rate of change of the animation over time, affecting its acceleration or deceleration.
AAI.name: easing

AAJ.caption: anchor
AAJ.doc: Defines which position of the element regarding to window should trigger the animation. Please be attentive, depending on user scrolling behavior and the speed at which the user scrolls, the anchor might not accurately predict when the element should animate, leading to unexpected or inconsistent animation behavior. Best practice are the bottoms anchors.
AAJ.name: anchor

AAK.caption: delay
AAK.doc: Values from 0 to 3000, with step 50ms. Specifies the delay before the animation starts. This property determines the time interval between the element coming into view and the animation beginning.
AAK.name: delay

AAL.caption: duration
AAL.doc: Values from 0 to 3000, with step 50ms. Specifies the duration of the animation. This property defines how long the animation lasts once it begins. It determines the length of time it takes for the animated elements to transition from their initial state to their final state.
AAL.name: duration

AAO.caption: debounceDelay
AAO.doc: the delay on debounce used while resizing window (advanced). Specifies the delay between successive calls to the AOS initialization function. It's like a pause between actions, ensuring the AOS initialization only happens after a quiet period, reducing unnecessary reinitializations.
AAO.name: debounceDelay

AAP.caption: throttleDelay
AAP.doc: the delay on throttle used while scrolling the page (advanced). Determines how often the AOS initialization function can be called within a certain timeframe. It's like a speed limit, preventing frequent calls to optimize performance and prevent the webpage from becoming too busy with constant updates.
AAP.name: throttleDelay

AAQ.caption: offset
AAQ.doc: This property determines at what distance from the top of the viewport the animation should trigger. For example, if the offset is set to 120 pixels, the animation will start when the element is 120 pixels below the top of the viewport. Be careful with its value, If the offset is set too high, animations might not trigger until the user has scrolled significantly down the page, or it may result in other visual problems.
AAQ.name: offset

AAR.caption: mirror
AAR.doc: Specifies whether the animation should be mirrored when scrolling in reverse direction. When set to true, this property causes the animation to play in reverse when scrolling upwards, effectively mirroring the animation's behavior.
AAR.name: mirror

AAS.caption: once
AAS.doc: Specifies whether the animation should only occur once or every time the element comes into view. When set to true, this property ensures that the animation plays only the first time the element enters the viewport, preventing it from repeating on subsequent viewings.
AAS.name: once
